clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Aripiprazole (Abilify) in Patients With Bipolar Mania
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Aripiprazole in Combination With Lithium or Valproate in the Long-Term Maintenance Treatment of Bipolar I Disorder in Outpatients Partially Nonresponsive to Lithium or Valproate Monotherapy

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical research study is to learn if outpatients with bipolar mania who are partially nonresponsive to lithium or valproate monotherapy can achieve stable symptoms on a combination treatment of aripiprazole plus lithium or valproate.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Not Experiencing Relapse to Any Mood Episode Through Week 52, Phase 3
primary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28, 32, 36, 40, 44, 48, 52 of Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
primary_outcome.description: Kaplan-Meier estimated survival rate. Criteria for relapse include one or more of the following: hospitalization for a manic, mixed or depressive episode; serious adverse event of worsening disease under study accompanied by a Y-MRS > 16 and/or a MADRS > 16; discontinuation due to lack of efficacy as determined by the investigator accompanied by a Y-MRS > 16 and/or a MADRS > 16.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline and Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Clinical Global Impression Scale for Bipolar Disorder (CGI-BP) Severity of Illness Score (Mania) Through Phase 3
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change from baseline in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on mania, depression and overall bipolar illness items on a 7-point scale [1 to 7], with 1 being normal and 7 being very severely ill). A negative change score signifies improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Not Experiencing Relapse of Manic Episode Through Phase 3
secondary_outcome.description: Kaplan-Meier estimated survival rate. Criteria for relapse include one or more of the following: relapse is defined as any of the following events accompanied by a Young-Mania Rating Scale (Y-MRS) >16 and/or a Montgomery Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) >16; serious adverse event of worsening disease, or discontinuation by the investigator for lack of efficacy. A hospitalization for a manic, mixed, or depressive episode does meet the criteria for relapse, however does not require an accompanying Y-MRS and/or MADRS score >16.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Not Experiencing Relapse of Depressive Episode Through Week 52 During Phase 3
secondary_outcome.description: Kaplan Meier estimated survival rate. Relapse is defined as any of the following events accompanied by a YMRS > 16 and/or a MADRS > 16; serious adverse event of worsening disease, or discontinuation by the investigator for lack of efficacy. A hospitalization for a manic, mixed, or depressive episode does meet the criteria for relapse, however does not require an accompanying Y-MRS and/or MADRS score > 16.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Baseline and Unadjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Young-Mania Rating Scale (Y-MRS) Total Score Through Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (end of ph 1), Weeks 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, and Phase 2 (Ph2) Endpoint. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, + Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: The Y-MRS consists of 11 items: 1) Elevated Mood, 2) Increased Motor Activity -Energy, 3) Sexual Interest, 4) Sleep, 5) Irritability, 6) Speech (Rate and Amount), 7) Language -Thought Disorder, 8) Content, 9) Disruptive-Aggressive Behavior, 10) Appearance, 11) Insight. Seven items are rated on a 0 to 4 scale, while 4 items (items 5, 6, 8 and 9) are rated on a 0 to 8 scale (twice the weight of the other items.) For all items, 0 is the "best" rating and 4 or 8 is the "worst" rating. Total Score is the sum of the ratings for all 11 items. The possible Total Scores are from 0 (best) to 60 (worst).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Baseline and Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Young-Mania Rating Scale (Y-MRS) Total Score Through Phase 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (end of Ph 2), Weeks 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28, 32, 36, 40, 44, 48, 52 of Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
secondary_outcome.description: The Y-MRS consists of 11 items: 1) Elevated Mood, 2) Increased Motor Activity -Energy, 3) Sexual Interest, 4) Sleep, 5) Irritability, 6) Speech (Rate and Amount), 7) Language -Thought Disorder, 8) Content, 9) Disruptive-Aggressive Behavior, 10) Appearance, 11) Insight. 7 items are rated on a 0 to 4 scale, while 4 items (items 5, 6, 8 and 9) are rated on a 0 to 8 scale (twice the weight of the other items.) For all items, 0 is the "best" rating and 4 or 8 is the "worst" rating. Total Score is the sum of the ratings for all 11 items. The possible Total Scores are from 0 (best) to 60 (worst).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Baseline and Unadjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Montgomery Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score Through Phase 2 and at Phase 2 Endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (end of Ph 1), Weeks 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, and Phase 2 (Ph2) Endpoint. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: The Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) is a ten-item diagnostic questionnaire used to measure the severity of depressive episodes in patients with mood disorders. MADRS total score, a 10-item, ordinal rating scale (0=no symptoms; 60=most severe symptoms). Change from baseline=postbaseline score - baseline score. A negative change score indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Baseline and Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Montgomery Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score Through Phase 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (end of Ph 2), Weeks 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28, 32, 36, 40, 44, 48, 52. Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
secondary_outcome.description: The Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) is a ten-item diagnostic questionnaire used to measure the severity of depressive episodes in patients with mood disorders. secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28, 32, 36, 40, 44, 48, 52. Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
secondary_outcome.description: Remission is defined as Y-MRS Total Score <=12 and MADRS Total Score <=12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Discontinuing For Any Reason Through Week 52 (During Phase 3)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])

secondary_outcome.measure: Deaths, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events (AEs), and Discontinuations Due to AEs During Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Phase 2 (a 13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with Adverse Events (AEs), Deaths, Serious AEs (SAEs), and AEs leading to study discontinuation. AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a cancer, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events in >=5 Percent of Participants, by Severity, During Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Phase 2. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. By Common Terminology Criteria Version 3.0 (CTC v3) Grade (Gr): Gr 1 (mild); Gr 2 (moderate); Gr 3 (severe); Gr 4 (life-threatening); Gr 5 (death).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Relevant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities During Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 (a 13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Sinus Tachycardia: ≥120bpm+↑≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of supraventricular (SV) or ventricular tachycardia or atrial fibrillation (AF) or flutter or other rhythm abnormality (RA). Sinus Bradycardia:≥50bpm+↓≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of AF or flutter or other RA. AF:not present→present or present at rate <100bpm pretreatment to present with rate ≥100bpm+increase of ≥15bpm. AV=atrioventricular; PR=PR interval. Other Intraventricular Block: QRS wave ≥0.12 sec+↑≥0.02 sec+no current diagnosis of left or right bundle branch block. Old Infarction not present→present at ≥12 weeks post study entry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Relevant Vital Sign Abnormalities During Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 (a 13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Heart Rate: increase, ≥120 beats per minute (bpm) and ≥15 relative to baseline (RBL); decrease, ≤50 bpm and ≥15 RBL. Systolic BP: increase, ≥180 mmHg and ≥20 RBL; decrease, ≤90 mmHg and ≥20 RBL. Diastolic BP: increase, ≥105 mmHg and ≥15 RBL; decrease, ≤50 mmHg and ≥15 RBL. For patients missing a baseline value, an on-treatment value was considered potentially clinically relevant if the value meets the criterion value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Relevant Laboratory Abnormalities During Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 (a 13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: ULN=upper limit of normal; HDL=high density lipoprotein; LDL=low density lipoprotein. Values for ULN are provided by the lab in the database and could be different for each individual patient based on characteristics such as age, gender, or other patient attributes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Baseline Homeostasis Model Assessment 2 (HOMA2)-Percent Beta
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: HOMA stands for homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance and beta-cell function. These are model-based calculations that use fasting insulin and glucose concentrations in order to assess pancreatic beta-cell function and insulin resistance. The HOMA2 model assesses beta-cell function (HOMA2-%β) relative to expected normal function (indexed to 100% for normal function) and is based on predictions from experimental human data on the relationship between insulin and glucose in a fasted state. HOMA2-%Beta is a percentage of 'normal function.'

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Baseline Homeostasis Model Assessment 2 HOMA2-Insulin Resistance (IR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: HOMA stands for homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance and beta-cell function. These are model-based calculations that use fasting insulin and glucose concentrations in order to assess pancreatic beta-cell function and insulin resistance. The HOMA2 model assesses insulin resistance (HOMA2-IR) relative to expected normal function (indexed to 1.0 for normal function) and is based on predictions from experimental human data on the relationship between insulin and glucose in a fasted state. HOMA2-IR is a proportion of 'normal function.'

secondary_outcome.description: HOMA stands for homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance and beta-cell function. The HOMA2 model assesses beta-cell function (HOMA2-%β) relative to expected normal function (indexed to 100% for normal function) and is based on predictions from experimental human data on the relationship between insulin and glucose in a fasted state. HOMA2-%Beta is a percentage of 'normal function.'

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The AIMS is an assessment of movement dysfunctions. It is a 12-item instrument assessing abnormal involuntary movements associated with antipsychotic drugs and 'spontaneous' motor disturbance related to the illness itself. Scoring the AIMS consists of rating the severity of movement in 3 main anatomic areas (facial/oral, extremities, and trunk), based on a five-point scale (0=none, 4=severe). The AIMS Total Score has a possible range from 0 to 28. Negative change scores indicate improvement in movement dysfunction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Unadjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) at Phase 2 Endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (end of Ph 1), Phase 2 Endpoint. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: The AIMS is an assessment of movement dysfunctions. It is a 12-item instrument assessing abnormal involuntary movements associated with antipsychotic drugs and 'spontaneous' motor disturbance related to the illness itself. Scoring the AIMS consists of rating the severity of movement in 3 main anatomic areas (facial/oral, extremities, and trunk), based on a five-point scale (0=none, 4=severe). The AIMS Total Score has a possible range from 0 to 28. Negative change scores indicate improvement in movement dysfunction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline in Simpson-Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The SAS is a 10-item instrument used to evaluate the presence and severity of parkinsonian symptomatology. It is the most commonly used rating scale for Parkinsonism in clinical trials over the past 25 years. The ten items focus on rigidity rather than bradykinesia, and do not assess subjective rigidity or slowness. Items are rated for severity on a 0-4 scale, with definitions given for each anchor point. The total SAS Score has a possible range from 10 to 50.(lower score=less severe). Negative change scores indicate improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Unadjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Simpson-Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score at Phase 2 Endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (end of Ph 1), Phase 2 Endpoint. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: The SAS is a 10-item instrument used to evaluate the presence and severity of parkinsonian symptomatology. It is the most commonly used rating scale for Parkinsonism in clinical trials over the past 25 years. The ten items focus on rigidity rather than bradykinesia, and do not assess subjective rigidity or slowness. Items are rated for severity on a 0-4 scale, with definitions given for each anchor point. The total SAS Score has a possible range from 10 to 50(lower score=less severe). Negative change scores indicate improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline in Barnes Akathisia Global Clinical Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale is a 4-item scale to assess presence and severity of drug-induced akathisia, including both objective items and subjective items, together with a global clinical assessment of akathisia. Global assessment is made on a scale of 0 to 5 with comprehensive definitions provided for each anchor point on scale: 0=absent; 1=questionable; 2=mild akathisia; 3=moderate akathisia; 4=marked akathisia; 5=severe akathisia. Score has a possible range from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe akathisia). Negative change scores indicate improvement in akathisia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Unadjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Barnes Akathisia Global Clinical Assessment at Phase 2 Endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (end of Ph 1), Phase 2 Endpoint. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: The Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale is a 4-item scale to assess presence and severity of drug-induced akathisia, including both objective items and subjective items, together with a global clinical assessment of akathisia. Global assessment is made on a scale of 0 to 5 with comprehensive definitions provided for each anchor point on scale: 0=absent; 1=questionable; 2=mild akathisia; 3=moderate akathisia; 4=marked akathisia; 5=severe akathisia. Score has a possible range from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe akathisia). Negative change scores indicate improvement in akathisia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Deaths, Treatment-Emergent Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events (AEs) in >=2% of Participants, and AEs Leading to Discontinuation During Phase 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with Adverse Events (AEs), Deaths, Serious AEs (SAEs), and AEs leading to study discontinuation. AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a cancer, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment-Emergent AEs in >=5% of Participants During Phase 3, by Age, Gender, Race, and Maximum Intensity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
secondary_outcome.description: AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. By Common Terminology Criteria Version 3.0 (CTC v3) Grade (Gr): Gr 1 (mild); Gr 2 (moderate); Gr 3 (severe); Gr 4 (life-threatening); Gr 5 (death).

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With Potentially Clinically Relevant Vital Sign Abnormalities During Phase 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
secondary_outcome.description: Heart Rate: increase, ≥120 beats per minute (bpm) and ≥15 relative to baseline (RBL); decrease, ≤50 bpm and ≥15 RBL. Systolic BP: increase, ≥180 mmHg and ≥20 RBL; decrease, ≤90 mmHg and ≥20 RBL. Diastolic BP: increase, ≥105 mmHg and ≥15 RBL; decrease, ≤50 mmHg and ≥15 RBL. For patients missing a baseline value, an on-treatment value was considered potentially clinically relevant if the value meets the criterion value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Baseline, Change From Baseline, and Highest Value of Change in HOMA2-Percent Beta, Phase 3 Safety Sample
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 52 (LOCF), Throughout Phase 3 (for highest value
secondary_outcome.description: HOMA stands for homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance and beta-cell function. These are model-based calculations that use fasting insulin and glucose concentrations in order to assess pancreatic beta-cell function and insulin resistance. The HOMA2 model assesses beta-cell function (HOMA2-%β) relative to expected normal function (indexed to 100% for normal function) and is based on predictions from experimental human data on the relationship between insulin and glucose in a fasted state. HOMA2-%Beta is a percentage of 'normal function.'

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Baseline, Change From Baseline, and Highest Value of Change in HOMA2-IR, Phase 3 Safety Sample
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 52 (LOCF), Throughout Phase 3 (for highest value
secondary_outcome.description: HOMA stands for homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance and beta-cell function. These are model-based calculations that use fasting insulin and glucose concentrations in order to assess pancreatic beta-cell function and insulin resistance. The HOMA2 model assesses insulin resistance (HOMA2-IR) relative to expected normal function (indexed to 1.0 for normal function) and is based on predictions from experimental human data on the relationship between insulin and glucose in a fasted state. HOMA2-IR is a proportion of 'normal function.'

secondary_outcome.description: Sinus Tachycardia: ≥120bpm+↑≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of supraventricular (SV) or ventricular tachycardia or atrial fibrillation (AF) or flutter or other rhythm abnormality (RA). Sinus Bradycardia:≥50bpm+↓≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of AF or flutter or other RA. AF:not present→present or present at rate <100bpm pretreatment to present with rate ≥100bpm+increase of ≥15bpm. AV=atrioventricular; PR=PR interval. Other Intraventricular Block: QRS wave ≥0.12 sec+↑≥0.02 sec+no current diagnosis of left or right bundle branch block. Old Infarction not present→present at ≥12 weeks post study entry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Simpson-Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score During Phase 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 4,8, 12, 24, 36, 52, throughout Phase 3 (for Highest Value of Change)
secondary_outcome.description: The SAS is a 10-item instrument used to evaluate the presence and severity of parkinsonian symptomatology. It is the most commonly used rating scale for Parkinsonism in clinical trials over the past 25 years. The ten items focus on rigidity rather than bradykinesia, and do not assess subjective rigidity or slowness. Items are rated for severity on a 0-4 scale, with definitions given for each anchor point. The total SAS Score has a possible range from 10 to 50(lower scores=less severe). Negative change scores indicate improvement.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 52 (LOCF), Throughout Phase 3 (for highest value)

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in AIMS Total Score During Phase 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 4, 8, 12, 24, 36, 52, throughout Phase 3 (for Highest Value of Change)
secondary_outcome.description: The AIMS is an assessment of movement dysfunctions. It is a 12-item instrument assessing abnormal involuntary movements associated with antipsychotic drugs and 'spontaneous' motor disturbance related to the illness itself. Scoring the AIMS consists of rating the severity of movement in 3 main anatomic areas (facial/oral, extremities, and trunk), based on a five-point scale (0=none, 4=severe). The AIMS Total Score has a possible range from 0 to 28. Negative change scores indicate improvement in movement dysfunction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in AIMS Item 8 During Phase 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 4, 8, 12, 24, 36, 52, throughout Phase 3 (for Highest Value of Change)
secondary_outcome.description: The AIMS is an assessment of movement dysfunctions. Scoring the AIMS consists of rating the severity of movement in 3 main anatomic areas (facial/oral, extremities, and trunk), based on a five-point scale (0=none, 4=severe). AIMS Item 8 Score range from 0 to 4. A negative score signifies improvement.

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on Change from Preceding Phase (mania, depression and overall bipolar illness) items (also a 7-point scale [1 to 7], with 1 being normal and 7 being very severely ill). A negative change score signifies improvement.

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, once daily lithium 250-2100 mg/day valproate 250-2500mg/day Placebo once daily
Tablets, Oral, once daily, 52 weeks post randomization (Pre-Randomization Phases 13-24 weeks) lithium 250-2100 mg/day valproate 250-2500mg/day aripiprazole 15-30 mg/day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women > or = to 18 years of age meeting Diagnostic and Statistical Manual for Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition, Text Revision (DSM-IV-TR) criteria for bipolar I disorder, currently experiencing a manic or mixed episode with a history of one or more manic or mixed episodes or sufficient severity to require hospitalization and/or treatment with a mood stabilizer or antipsychotic.

facility.name: University Of California, Irvine Medical Center
Behavioral Medical Research Of Staten Island
University Of Utah School Of Medicine

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

clinical_study.keyword: Bipolar I Disorder with a recent manic or mixed episode

group.title: Pre-Randomized Participants
group.description: Phase 1 (2 to 8 Week Screening, Washout and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase): lithium: 0.6–1.0 mmol/L or valproate 50–125 µg/ml. Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): 10-mg, 15-mg, or 30-mg doses of aripiprazole and lithium: 0.6–1.0 mmol/L or valproate 50–125 µg/ml.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): matching placebo oral tablets and lithium: 0.6–1.0 mmol/L or valproate 50–125 µg/ml.

measure.title: Body Mass Index (BMI) Category
measure.description: BMI is defined as weight in kilograms divided by the square of height in meters.

measure.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: BMI is defined as weight in kilograms divided by the square of height in meters.

measure.title: CGI-BP Change from Preceding Phase Score (Depression)
measure.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on Change from Preceding Phase (mania, depression and overall bipolar illness) items (also a 7-point scale (1 to 7), with 1 being very much improved and 7 being very much worse).

measure.title: CGI-BP Change from Preceding Phase Score (Mania)
measure.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on Change from Preceding Phase (mania, depression and overall bipolar illness) items (also a 7-point scale (1 to 7), with 1 being very much improved and 7 being very much worse).

measure.title: CGI-BP Change from Preceding Phase Score (Overall)
measure.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on Change from Preceding Phase (mania, depression and overall bipolar illness) items (also a 7-point scale (1 to 7), with 1 being very much improved and 7 being very much worse).

measure.title: CGI-BP Severity of Illness Score (Depression)
measure.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on Severity of Illness (mania, depression, and overall bipolar illness) items (a 7-point scale from 1 to 7, with 1 being normal, not ill and 7 being very severely ill).

measure.title: CGI-BP Severity of Illness Score (Mania)
measure.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on Severity of Illness (mania, depression, and overall bipolar illness) items (a 7-point scale from 1 to 7, with 1 being normal, not ill and 7 being very severely ill).

measure.title: CGI-BP Severity of Illness Score (Overall)
measure.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on Severity of Illness (mania, depression, and overall bipolar illness) items (a 7-point scale from 1 to 7, with 1 being normal, not ill and 7 being very severely ill).

measure.title: Montgomery Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
measure.description: MADRS consists of 10-items, ordinal rating scale The possible total scores are from 0 to 60 (0=no symptoms; 60=most severe symptoms). Change from baseline=postbaseline score - baseline score. A negative change score indicates improvement.

measure.title: Young-Mania Rating Scale (Y-MRS) Total Score
measure.description: The Y-MRS consists of 11 items: 1) Elevated Mood, 2) Increased Motor Activity -Energy, 3) Sexual Interest, 4) Sleep, 5) Irritability, 6) Speech (Rate and Amount), 7) Language -Thought Disorder, 8) Content, 9) Disruptive-Aggressive Behavior, 10) Appearance, 11) Insight. Seven items are rated on a 0 to 4 scale, while 4 items (items 5, 6, 8 and 9) are rated on a 0 to 8 scale (twice the weight of the other items.) For all items, 0 is the “best” rating and 4 or 8 is the “worst” rating. Total Score is the sum of the ratings for all 11 items. The possible Total Scores are from 0 to 60.

outcome.title: Proportion of Participants Not Experiencing Relapse to Any Mood Episode Through Week 52, Phase 3
outcome.description: Kaplan-Meier estimated survival rate. Criteria for relapse include one or more of the following: hospitalization for a manic, mixed or depressive episode; serious adverse event of worsening disease under study accompanied by a Y-MRS > 16 and/or a MADRS > 16; discontinuation due to lack of efficacy as determined by the investigator accompanied by a Y-MRS > 16 and/or a MADRS > 16.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28, 32, 36, 40, 44, 48, 52 of Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
outcome.population: Randomized Sample; n=number of participants at risk at each time point

outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change from baseline in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on mania, depression and overall bipolar illness items on a 7-point scale [1 to 7], with 1 being normal and 7 being very severely ill). A negative change score signifies improvement.
outcome.population: LOCF data set, phase 3 efficacy sample; n=number of participants evaluated at given time point

outcome.title: Proportion of Participants Not Experiencing Relapse of Manic Episode Through Phase 3
outcome.description: Kaplan-Meier estimated survival rate. Criteria for relapse include one or more of the following: relapse is defined as any of the following events accompanied by a Young-Mania Rating Scale (Y-MRS) >16 and/or a Montgomery Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) >16; serious adverse event of worsening disease, or discontinuation by the investigator for lack of efficacy. A hospitalization for a manic, mixed, or depressive episode does meet the criteria for relapse, however does not require an accompanying Y-MRS and/or MADRS score >16.
outcome.population: Randomized sample, n=number of participants at risk at given time point

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): matching placebo oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.description: Kaplan-Meier estimated survival rate. A hospitalization for a manic, mixed, or depressive episode does meet the criteria for relapse, however does not require an accompanying Y-MRS and/or MADRS score >16.

analysis.estimate_desc: Cox proportional hazards model, with type of mood stabilizer and type of index mood episode as stratification factors, and treatment group as covariate.

outcome.title: Mean Baseline and Unadjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Young-Mania Rating Scale (Y-MRS) Total Score Through Phase 2
outcome.description: The Y-MRS consists of 11 items: 1) Elevated Mood, 2) Increased Motor Activity -Energy, 3) Sexual Interest, 4) Sleep, 5) Irritability, 6) Speech (Rate and Amount), 7) Language -Thought Disorder, 8) Content, 9) Disruptive-Aggressive Behavior, 10) Appearance, 11) Insight. Seven items are rated on a 0 to 4 scale, while 4 items (items 5, 6, 8 and 9) are rated on a 0 to 8 scale (twice the weight of the other items.) For all items, 0 is the "best" rating and 4 or 8 is the "worst" rating. Total Score is the sum of the ratings for all 11 items. The possible Total Scores are from 0 (best) to 60 (worst).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (end of ph 1), Weeks 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, and Phase 2 (Ph2) Endpoint. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, + Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
outcome.population: Observed Cases (OC) data set; n=number of participants with measurement at given time point.

outcome.title: Mean Baseline and Unadjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Montgomery Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score Through Phase 2 and at Phase 2 Endpoint
outcome.description: The Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) is a ten-item diagnostic questionnaire used to measure the severity of depressive episodes in patients with mood disorders. MADRS total score, a 10-item, ordinal rating scale (0=no symptoms; 60=most severe symptoms). Change from baseline=postbaseline score - baseline score. A negative change score indicates improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (end of Ph 1), Weeks 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, and Phase 2 (Ph2) Endpoint. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
outcome.population: Observed Cases (OC) data set; phase 2 endpoint was phase 2 efficacy sample. n=number of participants with evaluation at time point

group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets

measure.description: The Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) is a ten-item diagnostic questionnaire used to measure the severity of depressive episodes in patients with mood disorders. MADRS total score, a 10-item, ordinal rating scale (0=no symptoms; 60=most severe symptoms). Change from baseline=postbaseline score - baseline score. A negative change score indicates improvement.

measure.title: Mean Baseline and Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Montgomery Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score Through Phase 3
measure.description: The Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) is a ten-item diagnostic questionnaire used to measure the severity of depressive episodes in patients with mood disorders. MADRS total score, a 10-item, ordinal rating scale (0=no symptoms; 60=most severe symptoms). Change from baseline=postbaseline score - baseline score. A negative change score indicates improvement.

outcome.title: Unadjusted Mean Change Baseline and Mean Change From Baseline in the CGI-BP Severity of Illness (Overall) Through Phase 2
outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change from baseline in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on mania, depression and overall bipolar illness items on a 7-point scale [1 to 7], with 1 being normal and 7 being very severely ill). A negative change score signifies improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (end of Ph 1), Weeks 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, and Phase 2 Endpoint. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
outcome.population: Observed Cases (OC) data set; phase 2 endpoint was phase 2 efficacy sample. n=number of participants with evaluation at time point

Patients are rated on mania, depression and overall bipolar illness items on a 7-point scale [1 to 7], with 1 being normal and 7 being very severely ill). A negative change score signifies improvement.

analysis.p_value_desc: Mean change from baseline: ANOVA controlling for treatment, mood stabilizer, type of index mood episode, baseline value. Mean change from preceding phase: ANCOVA controlling for treatment, mood stabilizer, type of index mood episode, baseline CGI-BP.
analysis.method_desc: Means, differences in means, 95% CI for the differences, and p-values are based on the ANOVA/ANCOVA model.

outcome.title: Unadjusted Mean Change From Preceding Phase in the CGI-BP (Depression) Through Phase 2
outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on Change from Preceding Phase (mania, depression and overall bipolar illness) items (also a 7-point scale [1 to 7], with 1 being very much improved and 7 being very much worse).
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, and Phase 2 Endpoint. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
outcome.population: Observed Cases (OC) data set; phase 2 endpoint was phase 2 efficacy sample. n=number of participants with evaluation at time point

group.title: Lithium
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets

group.title: Valproate
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.title: Unadjusted Mean Change From Preceding Phase in the CGI-BP (Depression) Through Phase 2
measure.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on Change from Preceding Phase (mania, depression and overall bipolar illness) items (also a 7-point scale [1 to 7], with 1 being very much improved and 7 being very much worse).

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change in CGI-BP From Preceding Phase (Depression) Through Phase 3
outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change from baseline (in this case, preceding phase) in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on mania, depression and overall bipolar illness items on a 7-point scale [1 to 7], with 1 being very much improved and 7 being very much worse).
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28, 32, 36, 40, 44, 48, 52. Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
outcome.population: LOCF data set, phase 3 efficacy sample; 4 participants in the Week 4 placebo group were not evaluated.

group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): matching placebo oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

outcome.description: Remission is defined as Y-MRS Total Score <=12 and MADRS Total Score <=12.
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28, 32, 36, 40, 44, 48, 52. Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
outcome.population: Observed cases data set, Phase 3 Efficacy Sample

analysis.method_desc: Stratified Log Rank Test p-value for equality of survival curves.

outcome.title: Deaths, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events (AEs), and Discontinuations Due to AEs During Phase 2
outcome.description: Participants with Adverse Events (AEs), Deaths, Serious AEs (SAEs), and AEs leading to study discontinuation. AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a cancer, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
outcome.time_frame: During Phase 2 (a 13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
outcome.population: Phase 2 Safety Sample

group.title: Lithium
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets

group.title: Valproate
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.title: Deaths, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events (AEs), and Discontinuations Due to AEs During Phase 2
measure.description: Participants with Adverse Events (AEs), Deaths, Serious AEs (SAEs), and AEs leading to study discontinuation. AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a cancer, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

outcome.title: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events in >=5 Percent of Participants, by Severity, During Phase 2
outcome.description: AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. By Common Terminology Criteria Version 3.0 (CTC v3) Grade (Gr): Gr 1 (mild); Gr 2 (moderate); Gr 3 (severe); Gr 4 (life-threatening); Gr 5 (death).
outcome.time_frame: During Phase 2. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
outcome.population: Phase 2 Safety Sample

group.title: Lithium
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets

group.title: Valproate
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.title: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events in >=5 Percent of Participants, by Severity, During Phase 2
measure.description: AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. By Common Terminology Criteria Version 3.0 (CTC v3) Grade (Gr): Gr 1 (mild); Gr 2 (moderate); Gr 3 (severe); Gr 4 (life-threatening); Gr 5 (death).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Relevant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities During Phase 2
outcome.description: Sinus Tachycardia: ≥120bpm+↑≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of supraventricular (SV) or ventricular tachycardia or atrial fibrillation (AF) or flutter or other rhythm abnormality (RA). Sinus Bradycardia:≥50bpm+↓≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of AF or flutter or other RA. AF:not present→present or present at rate <100bpm pretreatment to present with rate ≥100bpm+increase of ≥15bpm. AV=atrioventricular; PR=PR interval. Other Intraventricular Block: QRS wave ≥0.12 sec+↑≥0.02 sec+no current diagnosis of left or right bundle branch block. Old Infarction not present→present at ≥12 weeks post study entry.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 (a 13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
outcome.population: Phase 2 Safety Sample

group.title: Lithium
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets

group.title: Valproate
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.title: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Relevant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities During Phase 2
measure.description: Sinus Tachycardia: ≥120bpm+↑≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of supraventricular (SV) or ventricular tachycardia or atrial fibrillation (AF) or flutter or other rhythm abnormality (RA). Sinus Bradycardia:≥50bpm+↓≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of AF or flutter or other RA. AF:not present→present or present at rate <100bpm pretreatment to present with rate ≥100bpm+increase of ≥15bpm. AV=atrioventricular; PR=PR interval. Other Intraventricular Block: QRS wave ≥0.12 sec+↑≥0.02 sec+no current diagnosis of left or right bundle branch block. Old Infarction not present→present at ≥12 weeks post study entry.

category.sub_title: SV Premature Beat - not present → present
Ventricular Premature Beat - not present → present
1st Degree AV Block PR ≥0.20 sec and ↑ ≥0.05 sec
2nd Degree AV Block not present → present
3rd Degree AV Block not present → present
Left Bundle Branch Block not present → present
Right Bundle Branch Block not present → present
Old Infarction not present → present at >=12 weeks
Symmetrical T-Wave Inversion not present → present

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Relevant Vital Sign Abnormalities During Phase 2
outcome.description: Heart Rate: increase, ≥120 beats per minute (bpm) and ≥15 relative to baseline (RBL); decrease, ≤50 bpm and ≥15 RBL. Systolic BP: increase, ≥180 mmHg and ≥20 RBL; decrease, ≤90 mmHg and ≥20 RBL. Diastolic BP: increase, ≥105 mmHg and ≥15 RBL; decrease, ≤50 mmHg and ≥15 RBL. For patients missing a baseline value, an on-treatment value was considered potentially clinically relevant if the value meets the criterion value.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 (a 13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
outcome.population: Phase 2 Safety Sample

outcome.title: Median Baseline Homeostasis Model Assessment 2 (HOMA2)-Percent Beta
outcome.description: HOMA stands for homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance and beta-cell function. These are model-based calculations that use fasting insulin and glucose concentrations in order to assess pancreatic beta-cell function and insulin resistance. The HOMA2 model assesses beta-cell function (HOMA2-%β) relative to expected normal function (indexed to 100% for normal function) and is based on predictions from experimental human data on the relationship between insulin and glucose in a fasted state. HOMA2-%Beta is a percentage of ‘normal function.’
outcome.time_frame: Baseline
outcome.population: Phase 2 Safety Sample, number of participants with evaluation at time point

group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets

outcome.title: Median Baseline Homeostasis Model Assessment 2 HOMA2-Insulin Resistance (IR)
outcome.description: HOMA stands for homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance and beta-cell function. These are model-based calculations that use fasting insulin and glucose concentrations in order to assess pancreatic beta-cell function and insulin resistance. The HOMA2 model assesses insulin resistance (HOMA2-IR) relative to expected normal function (indexed to 1.0 for normal function) and is based on predictions from experimental human data on the relationship between insulin and glucose in a fasted state. HOMA2-IR is a proportion of ‘normal function.’
outcome.time_frame: Baseline
outcome.population: Phase 2 Safety Sample, number of participants with evaluation at time point

outcome.title: Baseline Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS)
outcome.description: The AIMS is an assessment of movement dysfunctions. It is a 12-item instrument assessing abnormal involuntary movements associated with antipsychotic drugs and 'spontaneous' motor disturbance related to the illness itself. Scoring the AIMS consists of rating the severity of movement in 3 main anatomic areas (facial/oral, extremities, and trunk), based on a five-point scale (0=none, 4=severe). The AIMS Total Score has a possible range from 0 to 28. Negative change scores indicate improvement in movement dysfunction.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline
outcome.population: Phase 2 Safety Sample, participants with evaluation at time point

group.title: Lithium
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets

group.title: Valproate
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.title: Baseline Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS)
measure.description: The AIMS is an assessment of movement dysfunctions. It is a 12-item instrument assessing abnormal involuntary movements associated with antipsychotic drugs and 'spontaneous' motor disturbance related to the illness itself. Scoring the AIMS consists of rating the severity of movement in 3 main anatomic areas (facial/oral, extremities, and trunk), based on a five-point scale (0=none, 4=severe). The AIMS Total Score has a possible range from 0 to 28. Negative change scores indicate improvement in movement dysfunction.

outcome.title: Unadjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) at Phase 2 Endpoint
outcome.description: The AIMS is an assessment of movement dysfunctions. It is a 12-item instrument assessing abnormal involuntary movements associated with antipsychotic drugs and 'spontaneous' motor disturbance related to the illness itself. Scoring the AIMS consists of rating the severity of movement in 3 main anatomic areas (facial/oral, extremities, and trunk), based on a five-point scale (0=none, 4=severe). The AIMS Total Score has a possible range from 0 to 28. Negative change scores indicate improvement in movement dysfunction.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (end of Ph 1), Phase 2 Endpoint. Phase 2 (13- to 24-week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase, which followed a 2- to 8-week Screening, Washout, and Confirmation of Partial Nonresponse Phase)
outcome.population: Phase 2 Safety Sample, participants with evaluation at time point

measure.title: Unadjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) at Phase 2 Endpoint
measure.description: The AIMS is an assessment of movement dysfunctions. Scoring the AIMS consists of rating the severity of movement in 3 main anatomic areas (facial/oral, extremities, and trunk), based on a five-point scale (0=none, 4=severe). The AIMS Total Score has a possible range from 0 to 28. Negative change scores indicate improvement in movement dysfunction.

outcome.title: Baseline in Simpson-Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score
outcome.description: The SAS is a 10-item instrument used to evaluate the presence and severity of parkinsonian symptomatology. It is the most commonly used rating scale for Parkinsonism in clinical trials over the past 25 years. The ten items focus on rigidity rather than bradykinesia, and do not assess subjective rigidity or slowness. Items are rated for severity on a 0-4 scale, with definitions given for each anchor point. The total SAS Score has a possible range from 10 to 50.(lower score=less severe). Negative change scores indicate improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline
outcome.population: Phase 2 Safety Sample, number of participants with evaluation at time point

outcome.title: Baseline in Barnes Akathisia Global Clinical Assessment
outcome.description: The Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale is a 4-item scale to assess presence and severity of drug-induced akathisia, including both objective items and subjective items, together with a global clinical assessment of akathisia. Global assessment is made on a scale of 0 to 5 with comprehensive definitions provided for each anchor point on scale: 0=absent; 1=questionable; 2=mild akathisia; 3=moderate akathisia; 4=marked akathisia; 5=severe akathisia. Score has a possible range from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe akathisia). Negative change scores indicate improvement in akathisia.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline
outcome.population: Phase 2 Safety Sample, number of participants with evaluation at time point

outcome.title: Deaths, Treatment-Emergent Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events (AEs) in >=2% of Participants, and AEs Leading to Discontinuation During Phase 3
outcome.description: Participants with Adverse Events (AEs), Deaths, Serious AEs (SAEs), and AEs leading to study discontinuation. AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a cancer, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
outcome.population: Phase 3 Safety Sample

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): matching placebo oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

group.title: Aripiprazole
group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.title: Deaths, Treatment-Emergent Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events (AEs) in >=2% of Participants, and AEs Leading to Discontinuation During Phase 3
measure.description: Participants with Adverse Events (AEs), Deaths, Serious AEs (SAEs), and AEs leading to study discontinuation. AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a cancer, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

outcome.title: Treatment-Emergent AEs in >=5% of Participants During Phase 3, by Age, Gender, Race, and Maximum Intensity
outcome.description: AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. By Common Terminology Criteria Version 3.0 (CTC v3) Grade (Gr): Gr 1 (mild); Gr 2 (moderate); Gr 3 (severe); Gr 4 (life-threatening); Gr 5 (death).
outcome.time_frame: Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
outcome.population: Phase 3 Safety Sample; (n=number of participants in sample for each category)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): matching placebo oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

group.title: Aripiprazole
group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.title: Treatment-Emergent AEs in >=5% of Participants During Phase 3, by Age, Gender, Race, and Maximum Intensity
measure.description: AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. By Common Terminology Criteria Version 3.0 (CTC v3) Grade (Gr): Gr 1 (mild); Gr 2 (moderate); Gr 3 (severe); Gr 4 (life-threatening); Gr 5 (death).

outcome.title: Participants With Potentially Clinically Relevant Vital Sign Abnormalities During Phase 3
outcome.description: Heart Rate: increase, ≥120 beats per minute (bpm) and ≥15 relative to baseline (RBL); decrease, ≤50 bpm and ≥15 RBL. Systolic BP: increase, ≥180 mmHg and ≥20 RBL; decrease, ≤90 mmHg and ≥20 RBL. Diastolic BP: increase, ≥105 mmHg and ≥15 RBL; decrease, ≤50 mmHg and ≥15 RBL. For patients missing a baseline value, an on-treatment value was considered potentially clinically relevant if the value meets the criterion value.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
outcome.population: Phase 3 Safety Sample; n= number of participants with measurement

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): matching placebo oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

group.title: Aripiprazole
group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.description: Heart Rate: increase, ≥120 beats per minute (bpm) and ≥15 relative to baseline (RBL); decrease, ≤50 bpm and ≥15 RBL. Systolic BP: increase, ≥180 mmHg and ≥20 RBL; decrease, ≤90 mmHg and ≥20 RBL. Diastolic BP: increase, ≥105 mmHg and ≥15 RBL; decrease, ≤50 mmHg and ≥15 RBL. For patients missing a baseline value, an on-treatment value was considered potentially clinically relevant if the value meets the criterion value.

outcome.title: Median Baseline, Change From Baseline, and Highest Value of Change in HOMA2-Percent Beta, Phase 3 Safety Sample
outcome.description: HOMA stands for homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance and beta-cell function. These are model-based calculations that use fasting insulin and glucose concentrations in order to assess pancreatic beta-cell function and insulin resistance. The HOMA2 model assesses beta-cell function (HOMA2-%β) relative to expected normal function (indexed to 100% for normal function) and is based on predictions from experimental human data on the relationship between insulin and glucose in a fasted state. HOMA2-%Beta is a percentage of ‘normal function.’

outcome.title: Median Baseline, Change From Baseline, and Highest Value of Change in HOMA2-IR, Phase 3 Safety Sample
outcome.description: HOMA stands for homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance and beta-cell function. These are model-based calculations that use fasting insulin and glucose concentrations in order to assess pancreatic beta-cell function and insulin resistance. The HOMA2 model assesses insulin resistance (HOMA2-IR) relative to expected normal function (indexed to 1.0 for normal function) and is based on predictions from experimental human data on the relationship between insulin and glucose in a fasted state. HOMA2-IR is a proportion of ‘normal function.’

measure.description: HOMA stands for homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance and beta-cell function. These are model-based calculations that use fasting insulin and glucose concentrations in order to assess pancreatic beta-cell function and insulin resistance. The HOMA2 model assesses insulin resistance (HOMA2-IR) relative to expected normal function (indexed to 1.0 for normal function) and is based on predictions from experimental human data on the relationship between insulin and glucose in a fasted state. HOMA2-IR is a proportion of ‘normal function.’

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Relevant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities During Phase 3
outcome.description: Sinus Tachycardia: ≥120bpm+↑≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of supraventricular (SV) or ventricular tachycardia or atrial fibrillation (AF) or flutter or other rhythm abnormality (RA). Sinus Bradycardia:≥50bpm+↓≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of AF or flutter or other RA. AF:not present→present or present at rate <100bpm pretreatment to present with rate ≥100bpm+increase of ≥15bpm. AV=atrioventricular; PR=PR interval. Other Intraventricular Block: QRS wave ≥0.12 sec+↑≥0.02 sec+no current diagnosis of left or right bundle branch block. Old Infarction not present→present at ≥12 weeks post study entry.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 3 (A 52-Week Assessment of Relapse Phase following Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
outcome.population: Phase 3 Safety Sample

group.title: Lithium
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets

group.title: Valproate
group.description: Phase 2 (13 to 24 Week Stability and Maintenance of Stability Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.title: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Relevant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities During Phase 3
measure.description: Sinus Tachycardia: ≥120bpm+↑≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of supraventricular (SV) or ventricular tachycardia or atrial fibrillation (AF) or flutter or other rhythm abnormality (RA). Sinus Bradycardia:≥50bpm+↓≥15bpm+no current diagnosis of AF or flutter or other RA. AF:not present→present or present at rate <100bpm pretreatment to present with rate ≥100bpm+increase of ≥15bpm. AV=atrioventricular; PR=PR interval. Other Intraventricular Block: QRS wave ≥0.12 sec+↑≥0.02 sec+no current diagnosis of left or right bundle branch block. Old Infarction not present→present at ≥12 weeks post study entry.

category.sub_title: SV Premature Beat - not present → present
Ventricular Premature Beat - not present → present
1st Degree AV Block PR ≥0.20 sec and ↑ ≥0.05 sec
2nd Degree AV Block not present → present
3rd Degree AV Block not present → present
Left Bundle Branch Block not present → present
Right Bundle Branch Block not present → present
Symmetrical T-Wave Inversion not present → present

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Simpson-Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score During Phase 3
outcome.description: The SAS is a 10-item instrument used to evaluate the presence and severity of parkinsonian symptomatology. It is the most commonly used rating scale for Parkinsonism in clinical trials over the past 25 years. The ten items focus on rigidity rather than bradykinesia, and do not assess subjective rigidity or slowness. Items are rated for severity on a 0-4 scale, with definitions given for each anchor point. The total SAS Score has a possible range from 10 to 50(lower scores=less severe). Negative change scores indicate improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 4,8, 12, 24, 36, 52, throughout Phase 3 (for Highest Value of Change)
outcome.population: Phase 3 Safety Sample, OC Data Set and Week 52 LOCF; n=number of participants with evaluation at time point

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): matching placebo oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

group.title: Aripiprazole
group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Simpson-Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score During Phase 3
measure.description: The SAS is a 10-item instrument used to evaluate the presence and severity of parkinsonian symptomatology. It is the most commonly used rating scale for Parkinsonism in clinical trials over the past 25 years. The ten items focus on rigidity rather than bradykinesia, and do not assess subjective rigidity or slowness. Items are rated for severity on a 0-4 scale, with definitions given for each anchor point. The total SAS Score has a possible range from 10 to 50(lower scores=less severe). Negative change scores indicate improvement.

category.sub_title: Highest Value in Change During Phase 3 (n=164,162)

analysis.p_value_desc: ANOVA model, controlling for treatment and mood stabilizer, is used for baseline. ANCOVA model, controlling for treatment, mood stabilizer, and baseline value, is used for mean change from baseline.
analysis.method_desc: Means, differences in means, 95% CI for the differences and p-values are based on the ANOVA/ANCOVA model.

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in AIMS Total Score During Phase 3
outcome.description: The AIMS is an assessment of movement dysfunctions. It is a 12-item instrument assessing abnormal involuntary movements associated with antipsychotic drugs and 'spontaneous' motor disturbance related to the illness itself. Scoring the AIMS consists of rating the severity of movement in 3 main anatomic areas (facial/oral, extremities, and trunk), based on a five-point scale (0=none, 4=severe). The AIMS Total Score has a possible range from 0 to 28. Negative change scores indicate improvement in movement dysfunction.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 4, 8, 12, 24, 36, 52, throughout Phase 3 (for Highest Value of Change)
outcome.population: Phase 3 Safety Sample, OC Data Set and Week 52 LOCF; n=number of participants with evaluation at time point

group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Barnes Akathisia Global Clinical Assessment During Phase 3
outcome.description: The Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale is a 4-item scale to assess presence and severity of drug-induced akathisia, including both objective items and subjective items, together with a global clinical assessment of akathisia. Global assessment is made on a scale of 0 to 5 with comprehensive definitions provided for each anchor point on scale: 0=absent; 1=questionable; 2=mild akathisia; 3=moderate akathisia; 4=marked akathisia; 5=severe akathisia. Score has a possible range from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe akathisia). Negative change scores indicate improvement in akathisia.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 4, 8, 12, 24, 36, 52, throughout Phase 3 (for Highest Value of Change)
outcome.population: Phase 3 Safety Sample, OC Data Set and Week 52 LOCF; n=number of participants with evaluation at time point

group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): matching placebo oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

group.description: Phase 3 (52 Week Assessment of Relapse Phase): aripiprazole 10-mg and 15-mg oral tablets and 250-mg and 300-mg oral lithium tablets or 250-mg Depakote/valproic acid oral tablets

measure.description: The Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale is a 4-item scale to assess presence and severity of drug-induced akathisia, including both objective items and subjective items, together with a global clinical assessment of akathisia. Score has a possible range from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe akathisia). Negative change scores indicate improvement in akathisia.

outcome.title: Extension Phase: Mean Baseline and Mean Change From Baseline in CGI-BP (Mania)
outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Bipolar (CGI-BP) assesses global illness severity and change in patients with bipolar disorder. Patients are rated on Change from Preceding Phase (mania, depression and overall bipolar illness) items (also a 7-point scale [1 to 7], with 1 being normal and 7 being very severely ill). A negative change score signifies improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 72 of LTE Phase. LTE Phase (A 72-week Extension Phase [until study unblinding] following Phase 3 [52 weeks], Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])

outcome.title: Extension Phase: Deaths, Adverse Events (AES), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and Discontinuations
outcome.description: Participants with Adverse Events (AEs), Deaths, Serious AEs (SAEs), and AEs leading to study discontinuation. AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a cancer, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
outcome.time_frame: From first day until 30 days after the last dose of double-blind dosing in the Extension Phase (A 72-week Extension Phase [until study unblinding] following Phase 3 [52 weeks], Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
outcome.population: Extension Phase Safety Sample

outcome.title: Extension Phase: Adverse Events (AEs), by Maximum Intensity
outcome.description: AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. By Common Terminology Criteria Version 3.0 (CTC v3) Grade (Gr): Gr 1 (mild); Gr 2 (moderate); Gr 3 (severe); Gr 4 (life-threatening); Gr 5 (death).
outcome.time_frame: From first day until 30 days after the last dose of double-blind dosing in the Extension Phase (A 72-week Extension Phase [until study unblinding] following Phase 3 [52 weeks], Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])

measure.title: Extension Phase: Adverse Events (AEs), by Maximum Intensity
measure.description: AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. By Common Terminology Criteria Version 3.0 (CTC v3) Grade (Gr): Gr 1 (mild); Gr 2 (moderate); Gr 3 (severe); Gr 4 (life-threatening); Gr 5 (death).

outcome.title: Extension Phase: Participants With Potentially Clinically Relevant Laboratory Abnormalities
outcome.description: Chemistry, hematology, and urinalysis abnormalities considered by the investigator as clinically relevant. Hematocrit: ≤37%(M)/≤32%(F)+3 percentage pts↓from baseline.
outcome.time_frame: From first day until 30 days after the last dose of double-blind dosing in the Extension Phase (A 72-week Extension Phase [until study unblinding] following Phase 3 [52 weeks], Phase 2 [13 to 24 weeks] and Phase 1 [2 to 8 weeks])
outcome.population: Participants in Extension Phase Safety Sample with laboratory evaluation

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
